pullRequest.title: Avoid WARNING: Illegal reflective access by datadog.trace.instrumentation.java.concurrent.NewTaskFor
pullRequest.bodyText:
Merge NewTaskFor with WrapRunnableAsNewTaskInstrumentation by using a placeholder 'newTaskFor' call.
The placeholder call in the advice will be rewritten to call the real 'newTaskFor' at build time.
Note: once the advice has been rewritten it can only be applied to executors that extend AbstractExecutorService otherwise we get class verification errors at load time. For other executors we apply a different wrapper that avoids 'newTaskFor'. This results in a bit of duplication but that's tolerated as it means we can avoid having to inject helpers onto the bootclasspath.

commit.message:
Merge NewTaskFor with WrapRunnableAsNewTaskInstrumentation by using a placeholder 'newTaskFor' call.
The placeholder call in the advice will be rewritten to call the real 'newTaskFor' at build time.

Note: once the 'NewTaskFor' advice has been rewritten it can only be applied to executors that extend
AbstractExecutorService otherwise we get class verification errors at load time. For other executors
we apply a simpler wrapper that avoids 'newTaskFor'. This results in a bit of duplication but that's
tolerated as it means we can avoid having to inject helpers onto the bootclasspath.

nodes.bodyText: You probably don't need this at all if you get rid of the netty executors which don't extend AbstractExecutorService i.e. the executor groups. They always delegate anyway, so everything should work fine.
I think we should aim to do more at build time 👍🏻
This is neat (now I've found the logic amongst all those final keywords)

commit.message: Remove Netty executor groups from instrumentation because they eventually delegate to an executor that does extend AbstractExecutorService
